title: Contributing to iSEEpathways
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to iSEEpathways
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to iSEEpathways
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("iSEE/iSEEpathways", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to iSEEpathways
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to iSEEpathways
text: Please note iSEEpathways project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with iSEEpathways
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Getting help with iSEEpathways
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. See also Bioconductor help website. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. Bioconductor-related question, please ask Bioconductor Support Website using appropriate package tag (website send automatic email package authors). people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

text: efficient possible, development tidyverse packages tends bursty, shouldn’t worry don’t get immediate response. Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

title: Working with the Gene Ontology
text: vignette, demonstrate one may use package GO.db dynamically display additional information selected pathways interactive user interface.

title: Working with the Gene Ontology
text: First, generate pathway analysis results simulated data using fgsea. particular, use package org.Hs.eg.db fetch real gene sets. reduce memory footprint, retain gene sets associated 15 500 genes. , simulate score gene present remaining gene sets. practice, score log2 fold-change gene differential expression analysis (among possibilities). Finally, perform FGSEA simulated data. , embed fgsea results SummarizedExperiment object. case, create empty ?SummarizedExperiment-class object, without simulated count data metadata, using data example. embed pathway analysis results newly created ?SummarizedExperiment-class object. first, reorder results increasing p-value. Although essential, implicitly defines default ordering table live app.
code: library("org.Hs.eg.db") library("fgsea")  # Example data ----  ## Pathways pathways <- select(org.Hs.eg.db, keys(org.Hs.eg.db, "SYMBOL"), c("GOALL"), keytype = "SYMBOL") pathways <- subset(pathways, ONTOLOGYALL == "BP") pathways <- unique(pathways[, c("SYMBOL", "GOALL")]) pathways <- split(pathways$SYMBOL, pathways$GOALL) len_pathways <- lengths(pathways) pathways <- pathways[len_pathways > 15 & len_pathways < 500]  ## Features set.seed(1) # simulate a score for all genes found across all pathways feature_stats <- rnorm(length(unique(unlist(pathways)))) names(feature_stats) <- unique(unlist(pathways)) # arbitrarily select a pathway to simulate enrichment pathway_id <- "GO:0046324" pathway_genes <- pathways[[pathway_id]] # increase score of genes in the selected pathway to simulate enrichment feature_stats[pathway_genes] <- feature_stats[pathway_genes] + 1  # fgsea ----  set.seed(42) fgseaRes <- fgsea(pathways = pathways,                    stats    = feature_stats,                   minSize  = 15,                   maxSize  = 500) head(fgseaRes[order(pval), ]) #>       pathway         pval         padj   log2err        ES      NES  size #>        <char>        <num>        <num>     <num>     <num>    <num> <int> #> 1: GO:0046324 5.580596e-10 2.747886e-06 0.8012156 0.6285002 2.579677    60 #> 2: GO:0046326 3.235498e-08 7.965797e-05 0.7195128 0.6752985 2.492665    37 #> 3: GO:0010827 5.741078e-08 9.423023e-05 0.7195128 0.5326197 2.321216    78 #> 4: GO:0010828 3.204527e-07 3.944773e-04 0.6749629 0.6033620 2.334222    44 #> 5: GO:0046323 5.839380e-06 5.750622e-03 0.6105269 0.4855652 2.116329    79 #> 6: GO:0008645 4.383171e-05 3.597122e-02 0.5573322 0.3990657 1.864469   121 #>     leadingEdge #>          <list> #> 1: TNF, KLF.... #> 2: KLF15, F.... #> 3: TNF, KLF.... #> 4: KLF15, F.... #> 5: TNF, KLF.... #> 6: TNF, KLF.... library("SummarizedExperiment") library("iSEEpathways") se <- SummarizedExperiment() fgseaRes <- fgseaRes[order(pval), ] se <- embedPathwaysResults(fgseaRes, se, name = "fgsea", class = "fgsea", pathwayType = "GO")

title: Working with the Gene Ontology
text: example, configure app option PathwaysTable.select.details define function , given identifier GO term currently selected panel, displays information GO term. Although essential, user-friendly immediate way ‘translate’ machine-friendly database identifiers human-friendly descriptions.
code: library("iSEE") library("GO.db") library("shiny") go_details <- function(x) {     info <- select(GO.db, x, c("TERM", "ONTOLOGY", "DEFINITION"), "GOID")     html <- list(p(strong(info$GOID), ":", info$TERM, paste0("(", info$ONTOLOGY, ")")))     if (!is.na(info$DEFINITION)) {         html <- append(html, list(p(info$DEFINITION)))     }     tagList(html) } se <- registerAppOptions(se, PathwaysTable.select.details = go_details)

title: Working with the Gene Ontology
text: Finally, configure app initial state launch live app.
code: app <- iSEE(se, initial = list(   PathwaysTable(ResultName="fgsea", Selected = "GO:0046324", PanelWidth = 12L) ))  if (interactive()) {   shiny::runApp(app) }

code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {       install.packages("BiocManager")   }  BiocManager::install("iSEEpathways")  ## Check that you have a valid Bioconductor installation BiocManager::valid()

what: Quick start to using to iSEEpathways
title: Introduction to iSEEpathways
code: library("iSEEpathways") library("fgsea") library("iSEE")  # Example data ----  set.seed(1) simulated_data <- simulateExampleData()  pathways_list <- simulated_data[["pathwaysList"]] features_stat <- simulated_data[["featuresStat"]] se <- simulated_data[["summarizedexperiment"]]  # fgsea ----  set.seed(42) fgseaRes <- fgsea(pathways = pathways_list,                    stats    = features_stat,                   minSize  = 15,                   maxSize  = 500) fgseaRes <- fgseaRes[order(pval), ] head(fgseaRes) #>         pathway         pval      padj   log2err         ES       NES  size #>          <char>        <num>     <num>     <num>      <num>     <num> <int> #> 1: pathway_3193 0.0001211540 0.3204337 0.5384341 -0.2896765 -1.539403   352 #> 2: pathway_2245 0.0001281735 0.3204337 0.5188481  0.3838463  1.789193   119 #> 3: pathway_1942 0.0002489896 0.3688884 0.4984931  0.6384197  2.035004    22 #> 4: pathway_2564 0.0004065213 0.3688884 0.4984931 -0.2960470 -1.536240   266 #> 5: pathway_3993 0.0005506760 0.3688884 0.4772708 -0.4879636 -1.879389    46 #> 6: pathway_4437 0.0005542489 0.3688884 0.4772708 -0.2680266 -1.444987   428 #>     leadingEdge #>          <list> #> 1: feature_.... #> 2: feature_.... #> 3: feature_.... #> 4: feature_.... #> 5: feature_.... #> 6: feature_....  # iSEE ---  se <- embedPathwaysResults(fgseaRes, se, name = "fgsea", class = "fgsea", pathwayType = "simulated",                            pathwaysList = pathways_list, featuresStats = features_stat)  app <- iSEE(se, initial = list(   PathwaysTable(ResultName="fgsea", Selected = "pathway_1350 ", PanelWidth = 6L),   FgseaEnrichmentPlot(ResultName="fgsea", PathwayId = "pathway_1350", PanelWidth = 6L) ))  if (interactive()) {   shiny::runApp(app) }

title: Integration with other panels
text: vignette, use example differential expression pathway analysis workflow real data set demonstrate selection made panel pathway analysis results may transmitted row-oriented panels iSEE application.

title: Integration with other panels
text: use ?airway data set. briefly adjust reference level treatment factor untreated condition.
code: library("airway") data("airway") airway$dex <- relevel(airway$dex, "untrt")

title: Integration with other panels
text: also map Ensembl gene identifiers recognisable gene symbols, setting row names unique identifier composed either gene symbol, gene identifier, concatenate . Although essential, implicitly defines primary piece information displayed genes live app. information lost process, original Ensembl identifier corresponding gene symbol stored rowData() object.
code: library("org.Hs.eg.db") library("scater") rowData(airway)[["ENSEMBL"]] <- rownames(airway) rowData(airway)[["SYMBOL"]] <- mapIds(org.Hs.eg.db, rownames(airway), "SYMBOL", "ENSEMBL") rowData(airway)[["uniquifyFeatureNames"]] <- uniquifyFeatureNames(   ID = rowData(airway)[["ENSEMBL"]],   names = rowData(airway)[["SYMBOL"]] ) rownames(airway) <- rowData(airway)[["uniquifyFeatureNames"]]

title: Integration with other panels
text: also compute log-transformed counts, better visualisation differential expression live app.
code: library("scuttle") airway <- logNormCounts(airway)

title: Integration with other panels
text: run standard Limma-Voom analysis using limma::voom(), limma::lmFit(), limma::makeContrasts(), limma::eBayes(). , embed set differential expression results ?airway object using iSEEde::embedContrastResults() method.
code: library("edgeR")  counts <- assay(airway, "counts") design <- model.matrix(~ 0 + dex + cell, data = colData(airway))  keep <- filterByExpr(counts, design) v <- voom(counts[keep,], design, plot=FALSE) fit <- lmFit(v, design) contr <- makeContrasts("dextrt - dexuntrt", levels = colnames(coef(fit))) tmp <- contrasts.fit(fit, contr) tmp <- eBayes(tmp) res_limma <- topTable(tmp, sort.by = "P", n = Inf) head(res_limma) #>             logFC  AveExpr         t      P.Value    adj.P.Val        B #> CACNB2   3.205598 3.682244  36.49009 2.370569e-11 3.996779e-07 16.03257 #> DUSP1    2.864775 6.644455  28.95296 2.000429e-10 9.657686e-07 14.66891 #> MAOA     3.256099 5.950559  28.29381 2.472372e-10 9.657686e-07 14.44796 #> SPARCL1  4.489075 4.166904  27.99497 2.725926e-10 9.657686e-07 14.01663 #> PRSS35  -2.828186 3.224885 -27.47899 3.234271e-10 9.657686e-07 13.80831 #> STEAP2   1.894563 6.790009  26.91396 3.914512e-10 9.657686e-07 14.03974 library("iSEEde") #> Loading required package: iSEE airway <- iSEEde::embedContrastResults(res_limma, airway, name = "Limma-Voom", class = "limma") rowData(airway) #> DataFrame with 63677 rows and 14 columns #>                         gene_id     gene_name  entrezid   gene_biotype #>                     <character>   <character> <integer>    <character> #> TSPAN6          ENSG00000000003        TSPAN6        NA protein_coding #> TNMD            ENSG00000000005          TNMD        NA protein_coding #> DPM1            ENSG00000000419          DPM1        NA protein_coding #> SCYL3           ENSG00000000457         SCYL3        NA protein_coding #> FIRRM           ENSG00000000460      C1orf112        NA protein_coding #> ...                         ...           ...       ...            ... #> ENSG00000273489 ENSG00000273489 RP11-180C16.1        NA      antisense #> ENSG00000273490 ENSG00000273490        TSEN34        NA protein_coding #> ENSG00000273491 ENSG00000273491  RP11-138A9.2        NA        lincRNA #> APP-DT seq_name seq_strand #>                      <integer>    <integer>           <character>  <integer> #> TSPAN6                99883667     99894988                     X         -1 #> TNMD ENSG00000000003      TSPAN6 #> TNMD                          NA          TNMD ENSG00000000005        TNMD #> DPM1                          NA          DPM1 ENSG00000000419        DPM1 #> SCYL3 title: Integration with other panels
text: prepare Gene Ontology gene sets biological pathways using org.Hs.eg.db. Due use uniquifyFeatureNames() , must first map pathway identifiers unique Ensembl gene identifier, accurately perform pathway analysis using feature identifiers matching embedded differential expression results.
code: library("org.Hs.eg.db") pathways <- select(org.Hs.eg.db, keys(org.Hs.eg.db, "ENSEMBL"), c("GOALL"), keytype = "ENSEMBL") #> 'select()' returned 1:many mapping between keys and columns pathways <- subset(pathways, ONTOLOGYALL == "BP") pathways <- unique(pathways[, c("ENSEMBL", "GOALL")]) pathways <- merge(pathways, rowData(airway)[, c("ENSEMBL", "uniquifyFeatureNames")]) pathways <- split(pathways$uniquifyFeatureNames, pathways$GOALL)

title: Integration with other panels
text: Separately, define register function fetches gene identifiers associated given pathway identifier. function required transmit selections pathway-level panels feature-level panels. Due use uniquifyFeatureNames() , function must first map unique Ensembl gene identifier, accurately identify corresponding value rownames(airway).
code: map_GO <- function(pathway_id, se) {     pathway_ensembl <- mapIds(org.Hs.eg.db, pathway_id, "ENSEMBL", keytype = "GOALL", multiVals = "CharacterList")[[pathway_id]]     pathway_rownames <- rownames(se)[rowData(se)[["gene_id"]] %in% pathway_ensembl]     pathway_rownames } airway <- registerAppOptions(airway, Pathways.map.functions = list(GO = map_GO))

title: Integration with other panels
text: run standard GSEA analysis using fgsea. , embed set pathway analysis results airway object, using ?iSEEpathways::embedPathwaysResults method. first, reorder results increasing p-value. Although essential, implicitly defines default ordering table live app. showcase choice pathway analysis results live app, repeat process , time sorting different score combines log-transformed p-value absolute log-transformed fold-change.
code: library("fgsea") set.seed(42) stats <- na.omit(log2FoldChange(contrastResults(airway, "Limma-Voom"))) fgseaRes <- fgsea(pathways = pathways,                    stats    = stats,                   minSize  = 15,                   maxSize  = 500) #> Warning in preparePathwaysAndStats(pathways, stats, minSize, maxSize, gseaParam, : There are ties in the preranked stats (0.05% of the list). #> The order of those tied genes will be arbitrary, which may produce unexpected results. head(fgseaRes[order(pval), ]) #>       pathway         pval        padj   log2err        ES      NES  size #>        <char>        <num>       <num>     <num>     <num>    <num> <int> #> 1: GO:0046323 9.103491e-07 0.003970943 0.6594444 0.6486846 2.224200    60 #> 2: GO:0010827 6.238470e-06 0.009773977 0.6105269 0.6201464 2.121587    58 #> 3: GO:1904659 6.853398e-06 0.009773977 0.6105269 0.5632978 2.059816    85 #> 4: GO:0046324 8.962840e-06 0.009773977 0.5933255 0.6682559 2.181621    46 #> 5: GO:0031589 1.236526e-05 0.010787455 0.5933255 0.3877520 1.654913   289 #> 6: GO:0008645 1.627544e-05 0.011832248 0.5756103 0.5465959 2.003417    87 #>     leadingEdge #>          <list> #> 1: KLF15, L.... #> 2: KLF15, L.... #> 3: KLF15, L.... #> 4: KLF15, L.... #> 5: FAM107A,.... #> 6: KLF15, L.... library("iSEEpathways") fgseaRes <- fgseaRes[order(pval), ] airway <- embedPathwaysResults(   fgseaRes, airway, name = "fgsea (p-value)", class = "fgsea",   pathwayType = "GO", pathwaysList = pathways, featuresStats = stats) airway #> class: RangedSummarizedExperiment  #> dim: 63677 8  #> metadata(3): '' iSEE iSEEpathways #> assays(2): counts logcounts #> rownames(63677): TSPAN6 TNMD ... APP-DT ENSG00000273493 #> rowData names(14): gene_id gene_name ... uniquifyFeatureNames iSEEde #> colnames(8): SRR1039508 SRR1039509 ... SRR1039520 SRR1039521 #> colData names(9): SampleName cell ... Sample BioSample stats <- na.omit(   log2FoldChange(contrastResults(airway, "Limma-Voom")) *   -log10(pValue(contrastResults(airway, "Limma-Voom"))) ) set.seed(42) fgseaRes <- fgsea(pathways = pathways,                    stats    = na.omit(stats),                   minSize  = 15,                   maxSize  = 500) fgseaRes <- fgseaRes[order(pval), ] airway <- embedPathwaysResults(   fgseaRes, airway, name = "fgsea (p-value & fold-change)", class = "fgsea",   pathwayType = "GO", pathwaysList = pathways, featuresStats = stats) airway #> class: RangedSummarizedExperiment  #> dim: 63677 8  #> metadata(3): '' iSEE iSEEpathways #> assays(2): counts logcounts #> rownames(63677): TSPAN6 TNMD ... APP-DT ENSG00000273493 #> rowData names(14): gene_id gene_name ... uniquifyFeatureNames iSEEde #> colnames(8): SRR1039508 SRR1039509 ... SRR1039520 SRR1039521 #> colData names(9): SampleName cell ... Sample BioSample

title: Integration with other panels
text: user-friendliness live app, define register function displays details selected Gene Ontology gene set using GO.db package.
code: library("GO.db") #>  library("shiny") #>  #> Attaching package: 'shiny' #> The following object is masked from 'package:BiocStyle': #>  #>     markdown library("iSEE") go_details <- function(x) {     info <- select(GO.db, x, c("TERM", "ONTOLOGY", "DEFINITION"), "GOID")     html <- list(p(strong(info$GOID), ":", info$TERM, paste0("(", info$ONTOLOGY, ")")))     if (!is.na(info$DEFINITION)) {         html <- append(html, list(p(info$DEFINITION)))     }     tagList(html) } airway <- registerAppOptions(airway, PathwaysTable.select.details = go_details)

title: Integration with other panels
text: Finally, configure initial state launch live app.
code: app <- iSEE(airway, initial = list(   PathwaysTable(ResultName="fgsea (p-value)", Selected = "GO:0046324", PanelWidth = 4L),   VolcanoPlot(RowSelectionSource = "PathwaysTable1", ColorBy = "Row selection", PanelWidth = 4L),   ComplexHeatmapPlot(RowSelectionSource = "PathwaysTable1",       PanelWidth = 4L, PanelHeight = 700L,       CustomRows = FALSE, ColumnData = "dex",       ClusterRows = TRUE, ClusterRowsDistance = "euclidean", AssayCenterRows = TRUE),   FgseaEnrichmentPlot(ResultName="fgsea (p-value)", PathwayId = "GO:0046324", PanelWidth = 12L) ))  if (interactive()) {   shiny::runApp(app) }

what: Trading off memory usage for speed
title: Integration with other panels
text: function map_GO() defined earlier – map pathway identifier set gene identifiers – uses org.Hs.eg.db package ?AnnotationDbi::select() function. memory-efficient, repeated calls database gene annotations introduce bottleneck limits reactivity app. can improve speed app rendering trading increased memory usage. Specifically, can use object pathways created earlier named list pathway identifiers character vectors gene identifiers associated pathway, instead querying GO.db database. First, app self-contained, list pathways stored within airway object . instance, store metadata() airway object. , can write new, faster, function fetches gene identifiers directly list rather database. function take first argument single pathway identifier, second argument must called se match name SummarizedExperiment object used within app. trade , app now relies list pathway annotations available metadata se object, using additional memory benefit dramatically faster access. can launch new instance app, using initial configuration, update airway object.
code: metadata(airway)[["pathways"]] <- list(GO = pathways) map_GO_v2 <- function(pathway_id, se) {     pathway_list <- metadata(se)[["pathways"]][["GO"]]     if (!pathway_id %in% names(pathway_list)) {         warning("Pathway identifier %s not found.", sQuote(pathway_id))         return(character(0))     }     pathway_list[[pathway_id]] } airway <- registerAppOptions(airway, Pathways.map.functions = list(GO = map_GO_v2)) app <- iSEE(airway, initial = list(   PathwaysTable(ResultName="fgsea (p-value)", Selected = "GO:0046324", PanelWidth = 4L),   VolcanoPlot(RowSelectionSource = "PathwaysTable1", ColorBy = "Row selection", PanelWidth = 4L),   ComplexHeatmapPlot(RowSelectionSource = "PathwaysTable1",       PanelWidth = 4L, PanelHeight = 700L,       CustomRows = FALSE, ColumnData = "dex",       ClusterRows = TRUE, ClusterRowsDistance = "euclidean", AssayCenterRows = TRUE),   FgseaEnrichmentPlot(ResultName="fgsea (p-value)", PathwayId = "GO:0046324", PanelWidth = 12L) ))  if (interactive()) {   shiny::runApp(app) }

what: iSEE extension for panels related to pathway analysis
title: iSEE extension for panels related to pathway analysis
text: goal iSEEpathways provide panels facilitate interactive visualisation pathway analysis results iSEE applications.

title: iSEE extension for panels related to pathway analysis
text: Get latest stable R release CRAN. install iSEEpathways Bioconductor using following code: development version GitHub :
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("iSEEpathways") BiocManager::install("iSEE/iSEEpathways")

title: iSEE extension for panels related to pathway analysis
text: basic example shows load package:
code: library("iSEEpathways") library("fgsea") library("iSEE")  # Example data ----  simulated_data <- simulateExampleData()  pathways_list <- simulated_data[["pathwaysList"]] features_stat <- simulated_data[["featuresStat"]] se <- simulated_data[["summarizedexperiment"]]  # fgsea ----  set.seed(42) fgseaRes <- fgsea(pathways = pathways_list,                    stats    = features_stat,                   minSize  = 15,                   maxSize  = 500) fgseaRes <- fgseaRes[order(pval), ] head(fgseaRes) #>         pathway         pval      padj   log2err         ES       NES size #> 1: pathway_1350 0.0004373110 0.5905978 0.4984931  0.2858201  1.503211  299 #> 2: pathway_4907 0.0005947840 0.5905978 0.4772708  0.3250965  1.599638  178 #> 3: pathway_3983 0.0007509197 0.5905978 0.4772708  0.2558001  1.398213  451 #> 4:  pathway_398 0.0008716489 0.5905978 0.4772708  0.2799932  1.477849  305 #> 5: pathway_3359 0.0009809867 0.5905978 0.4550599 -0.3724340 -1.674911  106 #> 6: pathway_1289 0.0009835850 0.5905978 0.4550599  0.3479133  1.638048  124 #>                                                                            leadingEdge #> 1:  feature_6060,feature_9203,feature_1852,feature_1883,feature_12903,feature_2143,... #> 2: feature_9265,feature_6286,feature_14879,feature_9600,feature_5335,feature_12205,... #> 3:  feature_495,feature_12466,feature_13128,feature_3069,feature_5278,feature_4248,... #> 4:    feature_6478,feature_2164,feature_922,feature_4298,feature_6585,feature_1633,... #> 5:    feature_3879,feature_2726,feature_6870,feature_6787,feature_9700,feature_693,... #> 6: feature_6376,feature_12953,feature_8391,feature_3147,feature_7330,feature_11551,...  # iSEE ---  se <- embedPathwaysResults(fgseaRes, se, name = "fgsea", class = "fgsea", pathwayType = "simulated",                            pathwaysList = pathways_list, featuresStats = features_stat)  app <- iSEE(se, initial = list(   PathwaysTable(ResultName="fgsea", Selected = "pathway_3363 ", PanelWidth = 6L),   FgseaEnrichmentPlot(ResultName="fgsea", PathwayId = "pathway_3363", PanelWidth = 6L) ))  if (interactive()) {   shiny::runApp(app) }

title: The FgseaEnrichmentPlot class — FgseaEnrichmentPlot-class
text: FgseaEnrichmentPlot Panel subclass row represents set features (.e., rows). Selections panel can transmitted row-oriented panels.

title: The FgseaEnrichmentPlot class — FgseaEnrichmentPlot-class
text: FgseaEnrichmentPlot() returns object class FgseaEnrichmentPlot. addition, class inherits slots parent Panel class.

title: The FgseaEnrichmentPlot class — FgseaEnrichmentPlot-class
text: following slots control test procedure: ResultName, character scalar indicating name pathway analysis result display. PathwayId, character scalar indicating identifier pathway display. BrushData, list containing Shiny brush along x-axis (see ?brushedPoints). Defaults empty list, .e., brush lasso.

title: The FgseaEnrichmentPlot class — FgseaEnrichmentPlot-class

text: PathwaysTable() returns object class PathwaysTable.

title: The PathwaysTable class — PathwaysTable-class
text: following slots control test procedure: ResultName, character scalar indicating name pathway analysis result display. addition, class inherits slots parent Table Panel class.

code: x <- PathwaysTable(ResultName="fgsea") x #> Panel object of class PathwaysTable #>   Get or set individual parameters with ‘[[’  #>   Available parameters: #>     ColumnSelectionDynamicSource: FALSE #>     ColumnSelectionSource: --- #>     DataBoxOpen: FALSE #>     HiddenColumns:  #>     PanelHeight: 500 #>     PanelId: NA #>     PanelWidth: 4 #>     ResultName: fgsea #>     RowSelectionDynamicSource: FALSE #>     RowSelectionSource: --- #>     Search:  #>     SearchColumns:  #>     Selected: NA #>     SelectionBoxOpen: FALSE #>     VersionInfo: list of length 1

title: The iSEEfgseaResults class — iSEEfgseaResults-class
text: iSEEfgseaResults class used provide common interface pathway analysis results produced fgsea package. provides methods access set features pathway.

title: The iSEEfgseaResults class — iSEEfgseaResults-class
text: iSEEfgseaResults() returns object class iSEEfgseaResults.

title: The iSEEfgseaResults class — iSEEfgseaResults-class
text: class inherits slots directly parent class iSEEpathwaysResults.

title: The iSEEfgseaResults class — iSEEfgseaResults-class
text: iSEEfgseaResults(data, pathwayType, pathwaysList = NULL, featuresStats = NULL) creates instance iSEEfgseaResults class, : data data.frame produced fgsea::fgsea(). pathwayType character scalar specifying type pathway (e.g., "GO"). See embedPathwaysResults. pathwaysList named list pathways associated feature identifiers. featuresStats Feature-level statistics used pathway analysis.

title: The iSEEfgseaResults class — iSEEfgseaResults-class
text: following code snippets, x instance iSEEfgseaResults class. Refer documentation method details remaining arguments. embedPathwaysResults(x, se, name, pathwayType, ...) embeds x se identifier name. See embedPathwaysResults() details. pathwaysList(x) returns named list pathway identifiers associated

title: The iSEEfgseaResults class — iSEEfgseaResults-class
text: Kevin Rue-Albrecht

title: The iSEEfgseaResults class — iSEEfgseaResults-class
code: library("fgsea")  ## # Simulate example data ##  simulated_data <- simulateExampleData(n_pathways = 5, n_features = 100, pathway_sizes = 15:100)  pathways_list <- simulated_data$pathwaysList features_stats <- simulated_data$featuresStat se <- simulated_data$summarizedexperiment  ## # Run pathway analysis ---- ##  set.seed(42) fgseaRes <- fgsea(pathways = pathways_list,                   stats    = features_stats,                   minSize  = 15,                   maxSize  = 500) head(fgseaRes[order(pval), ]) #>      pathway       pval      padj    log2err         ES        NES  size #>       <char>      <num>     <num>      <num>      <num>      <num> <int> #> 1: pathway_4 0.08684211 0.2857143 0.24891111 -0.3611377 -1.3079994    77 #> 2: pathway_3 0.11428571 0.2857143 0.20429476 -0.4161521 -1.3133662    90 #> 3: pathway_2 0.49532710 0.7552083 0.08809450 -0.2666742 -0.9741345    37 #> 4: pathway_5 0.60416667 0.7552083 0.08312913 -0.2459574 -0.9332602    61 #> 5: pathway_1 0.83769634 0.8376963 0.06658921 -0.2175310 -0.8140116    59 #>     leadingEdge #>          <list> #> 1: feature_.... #> 2: feature_.... #> 3: feature_.... #> 4: feature_.... #> 5: feature_....  ## # iSEEfgseaResults ---- ##  # Embed the FGSEA results in the SummarizedExperiment object se <- embedPathwaysResults(fgseaRes, se, name = "fgsea", class = "fgsea",   pathwayType = "simulated", pathwaysList = pathways_list, featuresStats = features_stats) se #> class: SummarizedExperiment  #> dim: 100 8  #> metadata(1): iSEEpathways #> assays(1): counts #> rownames(100): feature_1 feature_2 ... feature_99 feature_100 #> rowData names(0): #> colnames(8): sample_1 sample_2 ... sample_7 sample_8 #> colData names(0):  ## # Access ---- ##  pathwaysResultsNames(se) #> [1] "fgsea" pathwaysResults(se) #> $fgsea #> iSEEfgseaResults with 5 rows and 7 columns #>                pval      padj   log2err        ES       NES      size #>           <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <integer> #> pathway_1 0.8376963  0.837696 0.0665892 -0.217531 -0.814012        59 #> pathway_2 0.4953271  0.755208 0.0880945 -0.266674 -0.974134        37 #> pathway_3 0.1142857  0.285714 0.2042948 -0.416152 -1.313366        90 #> pathway_4 0.0868421  0.285714 0.2489111 -0.361138 -1.307999        77 #> pathway_5 0.6041667  0.755208 0.0831291 -0.245957 -0.933260        61 #>                                    leadingEdge #>                                         <list> #> pathway_1  feature_84,feature_10,feature_4,... #> pathway_2 feature_42,feature_36,feature_66,... #> pathway_3 feature_42,feature_36,feature_84,... #> pathway_4 feature_42,feature_36,feature_84,... #> pathway_5 feature_42,feature_84,feature_10,... #>  pathwaysResults(se, "fgsea") #> iSEEfgseaResults with 5 rows and 7 columns #>                pval      padj   log2err        ES       NES      size #>           <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <integer> #> pathway_1 0.8376963  0.837696 0.0665892 -0.217531 -0.814012        59 #> pathway_2 0.4953271  0.755208 0.0880945 -0.266674 -0.974134        37 #> pathway_3 0.1142857  0.285714 0.2042948 -0.416152 -1.313366        90 #> pathway_4 0.0868421  0.285714 0.2489111 -0.361138 -1.307999        77 #> pathway_5 0.6041667  0.755208 0.0831291 -0.245957 -0.933260        61 #>                                    leadingEdge #>                                         <list> #> pathway_1  feature_84,feature_10,feature_4,... #> pathway_2 feature_42,feature_36,feature_66,... #> pathway_3 feature_42,feature_36,feature_84,... #> pathway_4 feature_42,feature_36,feature_84,... #> pathway_5 feature_42,feature_84,feature_10,...  pathwayType(pathwaysResults(se, "fgsea")) #> [1] "simulated" head(lengths(pathwaysList(pathwaysResults(se, "fgsea")))) #> pathway_1 pathway_2 pathway_3 pathway_4 pathway_5  #>        59        37        90        77        61  head(featuresStats(pathwaysResults(se, "fgsea"))) #>   feature_1   feature_2   feature_3   feature_4   feature_5   feature_6  #>  0.23742535 -1.31281425  0.74702859 -1.56251843  0.07105336 -0.63953477

what: Extract contrast results embedded in a SummarizedExperiment object — pathwaysResultsNames
title: Extract contrast results embedded in a SummarizedExperiment object — pathwaysResultsNames
text: pathwaysResults returns either pathway analysis results stored object single pathway analysis result name. pathwaysResultsNames returns names pathway analysis results embedded object.

title: Extract contrast results embedded in a SummarizedExperiment object — pathwaysResultsNames
code: pathwaysResultsNames(object)  pathwaysResults(object, name)

title: Extract contrast results embedded in a SummarizedExperiment object — pathwaysResultsNames
text: object SummarizedExperiment object. name (Optional) Name single pathway analysis result name extract. Use pathwaysResultsNames(object) list available names.

title: Extract contrast results embedded in a SummarizedExperiment object — pathwaysResultsNames
text: pathwaysResultsNames: names embedded contrast results available. pathwaysResults: list differential expression statistics. name missing, pathwaysResults returns list item contains results single pathway analysis. name given, pathwaysResults returns DataFrame contains results single pathway analysis.

title: Extract contrast results embedded in a SummarizedExperiment object — pathwaysResultsNames
code: library("fgsea")  ## # Simulate example data ##  simulated_data <- simulateExampleData(n_pathways = 5, n_features = 100, pathway_sizes = 15:100)  pathways_list <- simulated_data$pathwaysList features_stats <- simulated_data$featuresStat se <- simulated_data$summarizedexperiment  ## # Run pathway analysis ---- ##  set.seed(42) fgseaRes <- fgsea(pathways = pathways_list,   stats    = features_stats,   minSize  = 15,   maxSize  = 500) head(fgseaRes[order(pval), ]) #>      pathway      pval      padj    log2err         ES        NES  size #>       <char>     <num>     <num>      <num>      <num>      <num> <int> #> 1: pathway_2 0.1629213 0.8146067 0.18470647  0.3232076  1.2078961    39 #> 2: pathway_1 0.5502249 0.9067055 0.05998925 -0.2922706 -0.9574770    79 #> 3: pathway_4 0.6109375 0.9067055 0.05700595 -0.2849186 -0.9191748    32 #> 4: pathway_3 0.7906977 0.9067055 0.04477489 -0.2704209 -0.7902678    88 #> 5: pathway_5 0.9067055 0.9067055 0.06799226  0.1875875  0.7315551    63 #>     leadingEdge #>          <list> #> 1: feature_.... #> 2: feature_.... #> 3: feature_.... #> 4: feature_.... #> 5: feature_....  ## # iSEEfgseaResults ---- ##  se <- embedPathwaysResults(fgseaRes, se, name = "fgsea", class = "fgsea", pathwayType = "GO",   pathwaysList = pathways_list, featuresStats = features_stats)  ## # List result names --- ##  pathwaysResultsNames(se) #> [1] "fgsea"  ## # Extract results --- ##  pathwaysResults(se) #> $fgsea #> iSEEfgseaResults with 5 rows and 7 columns #>                pval      padj   log2err        ES       NES      size #>           <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <integer> #> pathway_1  0.550225  0.906706 0.0599892 -0.292271 -0.957477        79 #> pathway_2  0.162921  0.814607 0.1847065  0.323208  1.207896        39 #> pathway_3  0.790698  0.906706 0.0447749 -0.270421 -0.790268        88 #> pathway_4  0.610938  0.906706 0.0570060 -0.284919 -0.919175        32 #> pathway_5  0.906706  0.906706 0.0679923  0.187588  0.731555        63 #>                                    leadingEdge #>                                         <list> #> pathway_1  feature_73,feature_22,feature_4,... #> pathway_2 feature_83,feature_80,feature_57,... #> pathway_3 feature_73,feature_75,feature_36,... #> pathway_4 feature_22,feature_11,feature_18,... #> pathway_5 feature_83,feature_80,feature_23,... #>  pathwaysResults(se, "fgsea") #> iSEEfgseaResults with 5 rows and 7 columns #>                pval      padj   log2err        ES       NES      size #>           <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <integer> #> pathway_1  0.550225  0.906706 0.0599892 -0.292271 -0.957477        79 #> pathway_2  0.162921  0.814607 0.1847065  0.323208  1.207896        39 #> pathway_3  0.790698  0.906706 0.0447749 -0.270421 -0.790268        88 #> pathway_4  0.610938  0.906706 0.0570060 -0.284919 -0.919175        32 #> pathway_5  0.906706  0.906706 0.0679923  0.187588  0.731555        63 #>                                    leadingEdge #>                                         <list> #> pathway_1  feature_73,feature_22,feature_4,... #> pathway_2 feature_83,feature_80,feature_57,... #> pathway_3 feature_73,feature_75,feature_36,... #> pathway_4 feature_22,feature_11,feature_18,... #> pathway_5 feature_83,feature_80,feature_23,...

title: Simulate Example Data — simulateExampleData
text: Simulates various pieces data purpose demonstration vignettes help pages.

title: Simulate Example Data — simulateExampleData
code: simulateExampleData(   n_pathways = 5000,   n_features = 15000,   n_samples = 8,   pathway_sizes = 15:500 )

title: Simulate Example Data — simulateExampleData
text: n_pathways integer scalar, number pathways simulate. n_features integer scalar, number features simulate. n_samples integer scalar, number samples simulate. pathway_sizes integer vector, possible sizes pathway sample .

title: Simulate Example Data — simulateExampleData
text: list three elements: pathwaysList named list dummy pathways. Names represent pathway identifiers; values represent character vectors feature identifiers. featuresStat named numeric vector dummy feature-wise statistics. Names represent feature identifiers; values represent 'scores' (e.g., log2 fold-change) summarizedexperiment SummarizedExperiment object contains count matrix rownames colnames.

title: Simulate Example Data — simulateExampleData
text: least time , function generates dummy data purely purpose demonstrating format expected inputs. , independent pieces simulated data just – independent – meaning simulated counts, statistics, pathways related numerically, make biological sense. coherent piece information set feature identifiers, carefully coordinated rownames count matrix, names feature statistics, set features list pathways, panels app can transmit interpret shared piece information.

title: Simulate Example Data — simulateExampleData
code: set.seed(1) simulated_data <- simulateExampleData() head(lengths(simulated_data$pathwaysList)) #> pathway_1 pathway_2 pathway_3 pathway_4 pathway_5 pathway_6  #>       338       181       143       432       485       313  head(simulated_data$featuresStat) #>   feature_1   feature_2   feature_3   feature_4   feature_5   feature_6  #>  1.17063084 -1.39634072  0.07569717  0.22496577 -0.94038886  0.58330266

what: Generics for Embbedding Pathway Analysis Results into a SummarizedExperiment Object — utils-SummarizedExperiment
title: Generics for Embbedding Pathway Analysis Results into a SummarizedExperiment Object — utils-SummarizedExperiment
text: overview generics embedding pathway analysis results SummarizedExperiment object, format compatible iSEEpathways.

title: Generics for Embbedding Pathway Analysis Results into a SummarizedExperiment Object — utils-SummarizedExperiment
code: embedPathwaysResults(x, se, name, pathwayType, ...)  embedPathwaysResultsMethods  # S4 method for class 'data.frame' embedPathwaysResults(x, se, name, class, pathwayType, ...)

title: Generics for Embbedding Pathway Analysis Results into a SummarizedExperiment Object — utils-SummarizedExperiment
text: embedPathwaysResultsMethods: Named character vector mapping keywords class names designed store pathway analysis results.

title: Generics for Embbedding Pathway Analysis Results into a SummarizedExperiment Object — utils-SummarizedExperiment
text: x Object embedded. se SummarizedExperiment object. name Identifier embedded object. pathwayType Character scalar indicating type pathway. See Details. ... Arguments passed individual constructors pathway analysis result classes. class Class use embedding x. used class(x) uniquely identify package generated object x.

title: Generics for Embbedding Pathway Analysis Results into a SummarizedExperiment Object — utils-SummarizedExperiment
text: embedPathwaysResults returns updated SummarizedExperiment object contains embedded object.

title: Generics for Embbedding Pathway Analysis Results into a SummarizedExperiment Object — utils-SummarizedExperiment
text: argument pathwayType= used identify function mapping certain type pathway identifier corresponding feature identifiers. Pathway mapping functions must registered named list using registerAppOptions(se, Pathways.map.functions = list(...)), name matching pathwayType identifies function use map pathway identifiers feature identifiers given pathway analysis result, e.g.   See vignette("integration", package = "iSEEpathways") examples.
code: library(org.Hs.eg.db) map_GO <- function(pathway_id) {   mapIds(org.Hs.eg.db, pathway_id, "ENSEMBL", keytype = "GOALL", multiVals = "CharacterList")[[pathway_id]] } se <- registerAppOptions(se, Pathways.map.functions = list(GO = map_go))

title: Generics for Embbedding Pathway Analysis Results into a SummarizedExperiment Object — utils-SummarizedExperiment
text: embedPathwaysResults(x, se, name, pathwayType, ...) embeds results x SummarizedExperiment se key name; pathwayType character scalar required identify function mapping pathway identifier asssociated feature identifiers; additional named arguments ... passed constructor pathway results class.

title: Generics for Embbedding Pathway Analysis Results into a SummarizedExperiment Object — utils-SummarizedExperiment
text: Kevin Rue-Albrecht
